My favourite game from the Trilogy. Why do you guys prefer the other 2?

snippet.textDisplay:
K. Rool:  Trying to climb the trees are you.  Sneeks stop them.  
Dixie: Rats seriously I think he could do better then that.  
K. Rool: Oh did I forget to mention something?  Kremlings.  Fetch the giant saw.  You better start climbing Kongs or you are going to be going timber.  Bwahahahahah.  
Dixie: You are cruel.
K. Rool: Of course I am.   Says it in my name.

snippet.textDisplay: If Retro Studios ever makes a DKC game after Tropical Freeze (which will be very difficult to surpass), they need to incorporate a remade version of this track in it somewhere, as well as Water World. Also, I hope David Wise and possibly Eveline Novakovic (or Fischer as she was known as back then) does the soundtrack. I really admire Wise, but I think Novakovic's contributions should not be overlooked, either.
snippet.textOriginal: If Retro Studios ever makes a DKC game after Tropical Freeze (which will be very difficult to surpass), they need to incorporate a remade version of this track in it somewhere, as well as Water World. Also, I hope David Wise and possibly Eveline Novakovic (or Fischer as she was known as back then) does the soundtrack. I really admire Wise, but I think Novakovic's contributions should not be overlooked, either.

snippet.textDisplay: +Nate Jacobson I just did a cover of this song, I've always loved how unpleasant it sounds. But yeah Eveline's contribution to this franchises shouldn't go unnoticed. I've never gotten behind all the nagging people had towards this game. The level design varied and the graphics were amazing.
snippet.textOriginal: +Nate Jacobson I just did a cover of this song, I've always loved how unpleasant it sounds. But yeah Eveline's contribution to this franchises shouldn't go unnoticed. Now THIS is the music that freaked me out when I was a kid playing this game. I recall being pretty darn scared of this level.

The GBA version's song for the saw level? Nooot so much... :/ It's a shame.

snippet.textDisplay: @Nupoe I feel the exact same way.  I feel like it was fact that the games of old didn't have gimmicks like a lot of the games have now. Games back in the day attracted people with creative worlds and songs that captured the moment and made the player feel like they were actually there. Thats why people free such great vivid memories from playing old games. They seem to really appreciate the experiences that they had.

All the beautiful graphics, and the difficulty level.... The fun, and the pure hatred for the tree levels.
